page.title: 14Changes in Village Life
page.content: Fifty years ago Chapel Allerton was a small, quiet village where most of the people worked on the nearby farms or were farmers themselves. There were few cars, no tractors and none of the noisy machinery of today. There were three shops in the village then and everyone used them for their shopping. Every morning the paperman cycled from Draycott to deliver the newspapers, the postman came at 07:00 a.m. and was never late. The butcher brought meat twice weekly and the baker came three times a week. The houses had no electricity. Oil lamps and candles were used for light. The water for baths was heated over a furnace and poured into a large tin bath in front of the fire. The only entertainment was listening to the wireless or going to whist drives and sometimes a dance in the village hall.
